title: M3 MacBook Pro: Everything you need to know
content:
Macworld

Apple has updated the MacBook Pro with M3-series chips. There are now just two sizes of MacBook Pro: a 14-inch, and a 16-inch model. The older 13-inch model with Touch Bar has now been dropped from the lineup.

The 14-inch and the 16-inch MacBook Pro are available with the new M3 Pro and M3 Max chips, while the 14-inch model is now available with the base M3 chip, although at a higher price than the equivalent 13-inch M2 MacBook Pro.

Find out about the new MacBook Pro models that arrived in October 2023 below.

New MacBook Pro M3 release date

  • Order now, available from November 7

The new 2023 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pro models with M3-series chips are available for preorder now from Apple.com.

You can choose from the following:

  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max

Preorder a MacBook Pro from Apple

All models will be available on November 7, except for the 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max, which will start shipping on November 9 in most configurations.

Read the news about the new MacBook Pro models.

What’s happened to the 13-inch MacBook Pro?

The 13-inch MacBook Pro has been discontinued, and with it, the Touch Bar is now dead. You can still buy the remaining stock of the 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 at some retailers and Apple’s Certified Refurbished store still has plenty of refurbished models for sale.

Take a look at our Best MacBook Pro deals to get the best price.

New MacBook Pro M3: Design and Features

The M3 MacBook Pro features no new design changes from the M2 models, with one exception: the M3 Pro and M3 Max versions of the MacBook Pro are now available in a sleek new Space Black color, as well as Silver. If you buy the base M3 14-inch model, you still have only Space Grey and Silver to choose from. There is no Titanium option, which some Mac fans had been calling for.

The display did get a tiny improvement, with SDR brightness now up to 600 nits from 500 nits in previous models.

Beyond the slightly brighter display, the features remain unchanged. The battery life figures from Apple are the same as the M2 generation, size and weight is the same, the camera, mics, speakers, ports, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth–it’s all just like the MacBook Pro with M2.

Apple

New MacBook Pro M3: Specs and price

While the 14-inch MacBook Pro models now start at a lower price, these M3 models are actually more expensive than their M2 predecessors, which started at $1,299/£1,349 for the now discontinued 13-inch M2 model, and are now $1,599/£1,699 for the 14-inch M3 model.

The prices of the M3 Pro models are also different to the M2 Pro equivalents. In the U.S. the starting price for the entry-level 14-inch M3 Pro is the same as it was, but in the U.K. it is now £50 less, while the 1TB model is now less in both locations (was $2,499/$2,699, now $2,399/£2,499).

The starting price of the M3 Pro 16-inch is also the same in the U.S. as it was, but less in the U.K. (was $2,499/$2,699, now $2,499/£2,599). The top of the range 16-inch M3 Pro model costs more than the M2 Pro equivalent, but that model offers 36GB Unified Memory rather than 16GB, although it also offers half the amount of storage (1TB is now 512GB).

Prices for the M3 Max models are also different. While the Max models now cost less in the U.K. in the U.S. the 14-inch M3 Max model now costs $100 more, and the 16-inch model costs the same (there’s also an additional M3 Max model in the 16-inch range).

Here are the specs and pricing for the 14-inch and 16-inch models.

14-inch MacBook Pro

  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 ($1,599/£1,699): base M3 chip, 8 CPU cores, 10-core GPU, 8GB unified memory, 512GB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Gray. A model with the same CPU but a 1TB SSD is $1,799/£1,899. This laptop replaces the 13-inch M2 MacBook Pro.
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro: Apple offers two standard configurations in Silver or Space Black:
    • $1,999/£2.099: 11-core CPU, 14-core GPU, 18GB unified memory, 512GB SSD
    • $2,399/£2,499: 12-core CPU, 18-core GPU, 18GB unified memory, 1TB SSD
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max ($3,199/£3,299): 14-core CPU, 30-core GPU, 36GB of unified memory, 1TB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Black.

All 14-inch MacBook Pro models include a MagSafe 96W power adapter.

16-inch MacBook Pro

  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro ($2,499/£2,599): 12-core CPU, 18-core GPU, 18GB of unified memory, 512GB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Black.
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Pro ($2,899/£2,999): 12-core CPU, 18-core GPU, 36GB of unified memory, 512GB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Black.
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max ($3,499/£3,599): 14-core CPU, 30-core GPU, 36GB of unified memory, 1TB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Black.
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M3 Max ($3,999/£4,099): 16-core CPU, 40-core GPU, 48GB of unified memory, 1TB SSD. Available in Silver or Space Black.

All 16-inch MacBook Pro models include a MagSafe 140W power adapter.
